Please send her and her family all the well wishes and good vibes during this time.

Brooklyn, you are so brave, strong, smart, and loved by all of us. We are here for you. We are so lucky to have you as one of our Mapleton students! Best wishes on your surgery and recovery! #braveforBrooklyn

post_text: Many children and adults are dealing with anxiety during this time. This is a great reminder for us all when we see these behaviors.
shared_text:
Connect the dots to ACEs
April 25 at 2:15 AM ·

Anxiety is a normal reaction to stress and can actually be beneficial to kids at times. Anxious thoughts trigger the brain to send out a warning signal for impending danger. When a child begins to cross the street without looking and an oncoming car is in the child’s path, for example, the anxious response signals the child to step back to the curb.

For some children, however, anxiety can become excessive and interfere with normal daily living. Anxiety can make it difficult for children to interact with peers and establish friendships, separate from parents to attend school or other activities and make it difficult for kids to learn.
It can also negatively impact their sleep, their eating habits, and their physical health.

post_text:
Message from PTO--
CONCERT BAKE SALE:
The PTO will be having a bake sale again this year before and after the students’
Holiday Concert, Thursday, December 19, 2019. In order for this to be successful,
we need all families to bring baked goods to school that day to be set up before the
concert. We all enjoy purchasing items at the bake sale. Because of its’ popularity,
we have run out of items in the past. Please consider bringing 2 or 3, or more
items, so that this year we won’t run out. The bake sale is free will donation,
and people are generous for those home-made holiday goodies. Let’s make it a
great fundraiser.
Items can be packaged in small, medium, or large sizes…variety is good. Sampler
plates are good too. So, if you are baking for the holidays anyway, please bake a bit
extra and support your PTO.
Candies, bars, cookies, caramels, fudge, cupcakes, pie, breads – WE LOVE IT ALL!

shared_text:
North Dakota United
June 19, 2019 at 4:57 PM ·

ND United President Nick Archuleta joined Governor Doug Burgum and ND Department of Public Instruction Superintendent Kirsten Baesler in celebrating some outstanding educators today at the Capitol at the first-ever Teacher Recognition Event. ND Teacher of the Year Kayla Dornfeld and finalist Annette Hovey were honored, along with the Milken National Educator award winner Brittany Larson, National Blue Ribbon School principal Jeffry Johnson, a group from Legacy High School in Bismarck who received an award for Excellence in Teaching with Project Based Learning, and seven teachers from West Fargo who all received National Board Certification. Congratulations to everyone!
